intro: Nasa cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Plumbaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Nasa cuatrecasasii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
